messages.message:
Welcome to the Symbaroum system


We are happy that you are using our system and wish you best of luck.
If you want to give some feedback on the system, the developers are active on both the Foundry Discord (channel #free-league) and Davokar Explorers Discord.

Foundry Symbaroum Official


The Foundry VTT Symbaroum system is now Official with the release of the Free League modules - buy them at Free League Store to help your game, or just to support further modules to be produced.

The team is still the same, with the passionate, awesome and humble devs dedicating their free time to enhance the system.

As always, drop by either the Foundry VTT #free-league discord, or the Davokar Explorers league discord, where the team are active to help or assist.

Symbaroum 3.1.8


We are happy to let you know that we released the Symbaroum 3.1.8.
This is likely the last release before Foundry v10 is released.

As always, if you have comments, please visit the #free-league channel on the Foundry Discord or join #symbaroum-vtt-foundry on Davokar Explorers League Discord. You can also see open features and bugs on our github page and are welcome to contribute. If you have comments, positive or negative feedback, please visit the #free-league channel on the Foundry Discord. You can also see open features and bugs on our github page and are welcome to contribute.

Preparations


We are gearing up for the release of Foundry v10 and with that a new version of the Symbaroum system. We expect the new version to be released when the commercial modules have a v10 version available. So the new version is not out yet.

An important note that the Symbaroum system will only support upgrading to Foundry v10 from Symbaroum v3.1.8. If you are currently on Symbaroum v3.1.8 or newer than you are all prepared.

If your system is older than 3.1.8, then we encourage you to upgrade to Symbaroum v3.1.8, as we can't guarantee a safe migration from older releases. Remember that always, when upgrading systems to make a backup - see Foundry tutorial for backups.

With Foundry, only you can prevent data loss

If you have to do a manual upgrade to v3.1.8 because foundry does not allow you to upgrade, please see https://foundryvtt.com/article/tutorial/ for how to perform a manual installation - the manifest for Symbaroum 3.1.8 can be found https://github.com/pwatson100/symbaroum/releases/tag/3.1.8 - There you can right click and select 'copy link' on the system.json and use that for your manual installation.

If you have questions and/or need help, ping us on either on #symbaroum-vtt-foundry on Davokar Explorers Discord or the #free-league channel on Foundry discord.

Avoding pain


In the next couple of weeks, give or take, Symbaroum and the commercial modules will go to v10. As part of that, it is prudent to remind everyone that backups are important. Once a world has been upgraded to v10, it can't go back unless you have a backup.
Remember to check your key modules work in v10, as they might not be available yet. If you are unsure and would like to test to see what works and what does not work in v10, you can follow the guide for running two (or more) versions of Foundry on the same machine. However, always make a backup.
If you have questions and/or need help, ping us on either on #symbaroum-vtt-foundry on Davokar Explorers Discord or the #free-league channel on Foundry discord.

Time is near


In just a few days we are going to release Symbaroum for Foundry VTT V10.
As always, take care and be in no hurry to upgrade. There are only minor fixes in this version - the majority of work has to make it fully compatible with Foundry VTT V10.

Before you upgrade, remember make backup - see this on how to make a backup. Once a world has been upgraded to V10, you can not go back.

The foundry discord have channel #v10-update-troubleshooting to help with upgrades if you run into problems, but as long as you have a backup, you can always rescue your world.

Symbaroum released for v10

The Symbaroum system has now gone to v10, with the Free-League Symbaroum modules as well. As always, make a backup, especially if you are going from Foundry v9 to Foundry v10. There are a couple of new features in v10 and some bugs squashed, but the majority of work has been to make it stable and ready for Foundry v10.

Note that while Symbaroum v9 and the modules works perfectly fine, there are no plans to enhance them further nor provide further bug-fixes for them going forward. For the Foundry Symbaroum System we will accept pull requests for it, if there is a brave soul wanting to enhance it further.

Feel welcome to drop in to the Symbaroum Davokar Explorers league discord were we Symbaroum developers often hang out in #symbaroum-vtt-foundry channel - or in the #free-league channel on the Foundry discord..

May Prios be with us all and glory to Nightbane, who saved us all
